result.execSummary:
The defendant Darryl Ripkoski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse programs.

from WI Court of Appeals - NOA received

Based on the foregoing, it is hereby ORDERED that the Judgment of Conviction in case number 15CF1233 be AMENDED to reflect that Ripkoski is required to comply with the sex offender registration requirements for 15 years following the completion of his extended
supervision.
Defendant's Postconviction Motion
IT IS ORDERED that the time for filing the defendant's notice of appeal or postconviction motion is extended to March 16, 2018.

Defendant appears in person along with Atty Mongin, defendant in custody. Atty W. Lemkuil appears for the State. 
Parties address Motion filed by defendant on 02/28/2017 - Court determines that Motion is not applicable to this matter and is denied by the Court. 
PSI previously filed with the Court - no corrections made. Sentencing re: Count 1 - 15. Counts 16 - 30 previously dismissed but read-in. 
State calls Lt. J. Valley - sworn and testifies, questions by Atty Lemkuil and Atty A. Mongin and the Court. 
Exhibit # 1 marked - Report from NECMEC - RECEIVED. 
Attorneys argue sentencing. State argues for 10 years IC and 10 years ES. Defense argues for 3 years IC  and a term of ES to be determined by the Court. Defendant addresses the Court on own behalf. 
SENTENCE AS FOLLOWS:
Count 1: 5 years IC, 5 years ES. 
Count 2: 5 years IC, 5 years ES - CONSECUTIVE to Count 1. 
Count 3: 5 years IC, 5 years ES - Concurrent to Count 1.
Count 4: 5 years IC, 5 years ES - Concurrent to Count 1.
Count 5: 5 years IC, 5 years ES - Concurrent to Count 1.
Count 6: 5 years IC, 5 years ES - Concurrent to Count 1.
Count 7: 5 years IC, 5 years ES - Concurrent to Count 1.
Count 8: 5 years IC, 5 years ES - Concurrent to Count 1. 
Count 9: 5 years IC, 5 years ES - Concurrent to Count 1. 
Count 10: 5 years IC, 5 years ES - Concurrent to Count 1. 
Count 11: 5 years IC, 5 years ES - Concurrent to Count 1. 
Count 12: 5 years IC, 5 years ES - Concurrent to Count 1.
Count 13: 5 years IC, 5 years ES - Concurrent to Count 1. 
Count 14: 5 years IC, 5 years ES - Concurrent to Count 1. 
Count 15: 5 years IC, 5 years ES - Concurrent to Count 1. 
Court does not permit defendant to participate in CIP or SAP.
CREDIT FOR 987 days on Count 1
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:
Costs + DNA surcharge + penalty surcharge x15 counts = $15,270.00 due during period of ES.
NO contact w/ any minors w/out agent approval. 
NO access to internet iw/out agent approval.
Comply with SORP - Register for 20 years following ES. 
Comply with all DOC rules and pay fees.
